items.content_html:
Summary

Google has moved to a different issue tracker, namely from Monorail to the Google Issue Tracker, and this means all prior bugs have received a new id.

This adds a link lint check, for which the linter needed to be made async, and fixes all issues.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Migrate Google issue IDs

items.content_html:
Summary

#24158 added clip:auto to MDN. clip is marked as deprecated, so my assumption is that clip: auto should also be marked as deprecated.

Test results and supporting details

https://drafts.fxtf.org/css-masking/#clip-property marks the property as deprecated.
items.title: Mark css.properties.clip.auto as deprecated

items.content_html:
Summary

Add partial_implementation: true for the implementation of the Notification API in Safari iOS.

The reason for this is that those BCD keys already have a note saying: "Notifications are supported in web apps saved to the home screen".
Requiring the site to be installed as an app on the iOS home screen is a big requirement for users, which means that most users will not see website notifications.

The right thing to do, to me, is to add the partial_implementation: true flag to make it more visible that the feature doesn't work in Safari for iOS, like it does in other browsers.
items.title: Mark iOS Safari's implementation of Notification partial because it requires the site to be saved to the home screen

items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 103-123 never aborted AbortSignal.timeout() with a TimeoutError.

Test results and supporting details

Tested with https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/play?id=Ully%2FbncqOhlj%2FACZTtIJLg1HtNlADkcgP4iWysbI6ercjFSzCJWkHPuAi5NNQRqGhL5ZlO5oTWm7TEr in BrowserStack Live, see this comment.

Related issues

Fixes #20381.
items.title: Add Chromium note about `AbortSignal.timeout()`

items.content_html:
I tried to generate web-features locally using WebViews as part of the browser set.

I found that there were a few keys that webview_ios wasn't set for.

As far as I can see, in each of the places it was missing it was set as mirror for other keys for those elements.
items.title: Add missing statements for webview_ios

items.content_html:
Summary

Firefox 132 ships the fetch() keepalive option in Nightly and early Beta builds.

This PR adds Fx preview support for api.fetch (as used for Window.fetch() and WorkerGlobalScope.fetch()) and Request.keepalive (doesn't yet have a docs page, but I'm going to change that).

It also adds a data point for the init.keepalive parameter of the Request() constructor, which just copies the same data from the other places.

See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1906952 for the shipping bug.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Docs issue: mdn/content#36120
items.title: Add Fx132 preview support for fetch() keepalive

items.content_html:
Summary

Addresses the documentation needs for Bug 1818968 cookies.get() should return the cookie with the closest matching path

Related issues

MDM content changes in mdn/content#36193
items.title: cookies.get orders cookies according to RFC-6265

items.content_html:
Summary

the data is taken from SVGElement.autofocus, as they both share the same test

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add svg.global_attributes.autofocus

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds missing fence and separator attributes to <mo> MathML element

Test results and supporting details

  • They are available in the MathML Core spec
  • They are already documented on MDN

Note

Only when sending the PR did I realize that for each one of them:

There is no visual effect for this attribute

Which means there’s no way to tell if they’re supported. Unless browsers might convey them somehow to a screen reader. Now or in the future. At the same time, it’s a way to complete BCD and document the standard status of the feature.

Given all that, I used the lowest MathML implementation version of all “supporting” browsers.
items.title: Add fence and separator attributes to <mo> MathML element

items.content_html:
This PR adds the missing flow member of the display CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.12.3).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/display/flow
items.title: Add missing css.properties.display.flow feature

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the setBadgeText.null member of the action Web Extensions interface. This fixes #22833, which contains the supporting evidence for this change.
items.title: Update Chromium data for webextensions.api.action.setBadgeText.null

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the scripting Web Extensions interface. This fixes #22832, which contains the supporting evidence for this change.
items.title: Update Chromium data for scripting Web Extensions interface

items.title: Update Chromium data for tabs Web Extensions interface

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the sessions Web Extensions interface. The data comes from a commit in the browser's source code, mapped to a version number using available tooling or via the commit timestamp.

Commit: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10d71e33310e3e3ae5f9d9f185b1d9665df0e845, https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/38f9258e83b4ce3e01f15c2e3009f43508892878
items.title: Update Chromium data for sessions Web Extensions interface

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the privacy Web Extensions interface. The data comes from a commit in the browser's source code, mapped to a version number using available tooling or via the commit timestamp.

Commit: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/607e6522f841933e0d3130c09d33207876850948, https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/75fc25972e9966a481e834dcd103de483bdffd99, https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/cc3a5c8ca42579c0f9f710c18f51c566b4c75e86, https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c537ba208c24c14ca0259e0492041b3f2e6a6eb9
items.title: Update Chromium data for privacy Web Extensions interface
